result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian P Gundersen was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Brian P Gundersen was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian P Gundersen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Order for Ignition Interlock Exemption signed and sent to DMV for the following vehicles: 2012 Zhejiang and 2003 Chevrolet
Requesting Ignition Interlock Exemption
treatment letter from Cornerstone Counseling dated 5/10/16
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brian P Gundersen in court with Attorney Andrew Peter Arena.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence hearing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 2.  Count #3 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Arena makes statements regarding sentencing.  Attorney Arena requests exemption of IID for 2 vehicles that Defendant owns.  Court orders Defendant to fill out proper paperwork for such exemptions and then submit to the court.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:

30 DAYS HUBER  -  Defendant to report to huber facility today, 5/13/16 by 6:00 p.m.     *Transfer allowed to Lincoln County*  NOTE:  No electronic monitoring allowed    

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid in 20 days, alternate 9 days jail if not paid)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**


COUNT #2:  HUBER:  60 DAYS (consecutive to Count #1), Release for work, treatment.  Defendant to report to huber facility today, 5/13/16 by 6:00 p.m.  *Transfer allowed to Lincoln County*  NOTE:  No electronic monitoring allowed    

FINE: $1,229.00 (to be paid in 20 days or serve 25 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine)

DL REVOCATION: 17 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 17 months

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brian P Gundersen in court with attorney Andrew Peter Arena.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for the defendant to complete the 120 day WCS requirement. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-11-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Brian P Gundersen in court with attorney Andrew Peter Arena.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to complete counseling. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 01-25-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Brian P Gundersen in court with attorney Andrew Peter Arena.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to undergo treatment. He is further requesting a plea and sentencing date. Court sets the matter for a status of his treatment.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Reviewed by Judge Maxwell 12/7/15
Hearing at 12-16-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Brian P Gundersen in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has retained counsel, but he is stuck in Milwaukee County. Court adjours for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing at 11-23-2015 09:30 am

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Brian P Gundersen in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
